newsitem.title: FRANCE: Bomb damages office of Corsica paper.
newsitem.headline: Bomb damages office of Corsica paper.

text.p: A bomb blast on the French Mediterranean island of Corsica damaged the offices of a daily newspaper overnight, causing some damage but no injuries, police said on Monday.

No one has claimed responsibility for the small blast, which blew out windows and wrecked computers at the offices of the regional edition of the Marseille-based newspaper Le Provencal, in the northern island city of Bastia.
The attack bore the hallmarks of Corsican separatists who are waging a bombing campaign to demand more autonomy from France for the island.
